The only thing we can do as a community is express our opinions on this, and hope they improve it next year.

At this point there is no way they are going to take everything back.

Hey Smelp, 

We're doing things [a bit differently](http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-pbe-feedback/Grefbrd1-a-note-about-the-harrowing) this year, so it won't be just like the Harrowing event you saw last year. Hope this clears things up!

Again, as we've said a million times, we as customers don't want Harrowing in the middle of July and hot outside. While I understand Harrowing can hit "any time of the year" we, as customers, want it during Halloween.

If you were going to do it twice a year with one time randomly and one time during late October I'd be down for that, but this is just isn't cool. I was really excited for Harrowing this year and now I'm so **disappointed**. You don't even know how much.
Yah... plus it kind of feels like they skipped a year now ._.

I wouldn't put it as "we as customers" because many other customers, like me, want a variety of content throughout the year. Of course they can have an event. If they have lore or content specific to the shadow isle, I don't want to wait until October for it. 
It puts expectations on them that, if the can't make it in time, everyone's mad. It also puts creative restraints on them. You can only do pool party skins during this time, or creepy skins during this time. Like the creativity fly.

I don't think people want pool party skins in winter.

Or Snowdown skins in summer.

From a _company _ point of view it is far more advantageous for them to give content to us when we're in the spirit of the holidays than to not, otherwise we'd see commercials for Christmas layaway in June. 

I understand lore wise that the Harrowing can occur at any time, but I'd also like this content during this time of year for a reason. It's October, its the spirit of the month, the seasons are changing and its fun to play games that are spooked out for October to get you in the mood. Maybe I feel it strongly because I'm Eclectic Pagan and I liked the idea of the Harrowing because it related to Samhain.

Like I said in my earlier post, if they were willing to do it twice a year (once in October for sure and then once randomly) I'd be all for that. But dang it there's a reason why we have these seasonal things. Be creative all you want but take into consideration what we want, i.e. the people buying the skins.

As for expectations? They run a professional company. There are going to be expectations, that's part of running a successful and profitable enterprise. They have a lot of creative minds so I expect better than this.

In terms of pool party and snowdown, they offer both because of the hemispheres.  However, because Riot is an American company, therefore based in the northern hemisphere, and celebrates American holidays, I expect Harrowing in Halloween, snowdown skins in winter, and pool party skins in summer (new ones).  They can offer snowdown bundles in summer, I'm ok with that.  I'm not ok with Harrowing in Easter, or Lunar Revel at New Year's Day.  That's just stupid.

I understand you guys are trying something different, and it must be a pain to reiterate that so often, but I am just a bit concerned for the time-scales on this thing... We were told we'll be getting a Harrowing story, but will there be a harrowing event? I think the reason a lot of people are upset about this year's harrowing is honestly because the Harrowing is something unique to League. Its a take on halloween that lends more mystery to the Shadow Isles, raises several questions about their nature, and is honestly an incredibly interesting take on the halloween season.

I'd also argue that opening the Harrowing to being "Able to strike at any time" actually does far more to injure that uniquity than it does to help it. If the idea is to make the Harrowing scary, the whole "Indeterminite Timebomb" thing from a playerbase perspective just feels a tad lazy. Sure it opens up the Harrowing to other times of year, but since Harrowing is League's traditional Halloween event, it just seems a bit tacky to throw it out say after Valentines or Saint Patrick's Day. The idea of the Harrowing being a deliberate time of year to prepare and fear is much more intimidating, more akin to Futurama's Murderous Robot Santa.

In Futurama, Santa never quite loses his fear-factor because everyone knows what he's capable of, and when he needs to come. Its less about being scared all the time (A feeling which would get tiring before long) and more about being concerned about how to deal with this unavoidable threat. The Harrowing falls into that latter category, being an event that should take potentially months of deliberation to ensure that especially Bilgewater is prepared to deal with the encroaching assault. Its a unifying force that threatens everyone, and is able to do so, because people have to work together to overcome it.

Can we have Harrowing events in the year that aren't harrowing related? Yes, lord yes we can. Not every aspect of the Shadow Isles is tied to the Harrowing, and the lands have more than enough wiggle room to tell interesting stories about their inhabitants, and their history. But Harrowing should not be one of those stories. Harrowing is meant to be a big deal, if it can literally come out at the drop of a hat, its less important, less intimidating, and from a lore perspective, less managable.

TL;DR
I understand you guys want to try something new. I understand you want to open the Shadow Isles to more options. But decoupling the Harrowing from being a proper seasonal event in exchange for "looming spoopiness" is a poor decision that hurts the event far more than it helps it.. Sure plenty of people are disenfranchised with the whole zombie deal, but the reason they're disappointed is because the Harrowing is so interesting and unique.

Even though it's not the Harrowing we're use to, props to the folks to made this. Really reminds me of the 60s-80s horror (that start up before it really begins). The music is absolutely sick. Love it all

To everyone here who has been using the term "we" in their comments,

**YOU ARE NO THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY SO PLEASE STOP TRYING TO TALK FOR EVERYBODY!**

You can have your own opinion, but not everyone has your exact opinion.

_Not everybody thinks zombies aren't scary._ If I saw dead and decaying _corpses_ walking around I'd get more than a little freaked out.

_Not everyone thinks the Harrowing event has got to be the same as that one year where everything was timed well for Halloween._ Good as that particular version of the event was not every Rioter is going to have that same kind of inspired style, and it is very likely that as a company if an employee has an idea for something new they will be willing to listen to him (which in the case of the zombie apocalypse theme they probably have).

_Not everyone cares whether the same event is at the same time every year._ If Riot had "Harrowing" skins ready in March why would they bother sitting on them for 6+ months when they could just have another skin set come out then? Or another example how many "creepy" skins has Riot released before that were not released on or even near Harrowing?

So taking into account the above, please start taking into account that you are not the entire community when you post and learn to adjust your comments appropriately.

Basically the content may be made for the players, but its not made by the players.

Now such a feature would be incredible useful if players were allowed to essentially vote on what kind of content they wanted to see happen next, and I sorta hope that's what Riot is leading up to with special events not being tied to a certain season anymore, However I also see where such a voting system could be abused by trolling players or trolls in general and Riot has usually been quite cautious about anything that would allow such abuse. Still, I can definitely admit a more noticeable heads up about the change in the event would have been nice.

And to possibly better explain the whole "don't say we" thing is that I feel very strongly about using the right words to describe what I mean to someone, and if I can't find the right words I tend not to say anything rather than be misunderstood.
